title: PROMPT DIRECTIVE
definition: Primary text command used to prime the neural network and establish the visual blueprint of the generated asset.
why_it_matters: Determines the composition, subject matter, and stylistic foundation. Specificity reduces entropy and ensures structural adherence.
pro_tips: Front-load critical data. Syntax: [subject] + [action] + [environment] + [lighting]. Use weights like (masterpiece:1.2) for priority control.

title: NEGATIVE PROMPT
definition: A selective exclusion filter used to suppress specific visual artifacts, unwanted styles, or structural defects.
why_it_matters: Essential for maintaining morphological integrity and preventing common AI deformities (extra limbs, blurry textures).
pro_tips: Focus on anatomical stability and clarity. Avoid over-filtering as it can restrict creative variability and pose data conflicts.

title: LORA UNIT
definition: Low-Rank Adaptation modules that inject specialized knowledge (objects, characters, or art styles) into the base model.
why_it_matters: Allows for precise control over consistency. Enables the generation of niche subjects not fully encoded in the primary model.
pro_tips: Limit active units to 2-3 to avoid stylistic interference. Multi-LoRA setups require careful strength balancing.

title: LORA STRENGTH
definition: Voltage control for the active LoRA unit, determining the influence of its specialized weight data on the final output.
why_it_matters: Critical for finding the 'sweet spot' between stylistic injection and structural stability. Too high leads to 'burned' results.
pro_tips: Nominal range: 0.6 - 0.8. If the base model starts losing coherence, decrease strength immediately.

title: RANDOM SEED
definition: The numerical starting point for the noise-to-image synthesis cycle. Determines the initial layout of pixels.
why_it_matters: Ensures reproducibility. Locking the seed allows for surgical changes to prompts while keeping the overall composition fixed.
pro_tips: Set to -1 for maximum entropy. Fix the seed to iterate on lighting or clothing while maintaining character pose.

title: ASPECT RATIO
definition: Spatial dimensions of the generation canvas. Defines the horizontal and vertical boundaries of the visual field.
why_it_matters: Composition is mathematically tied to the frame. Changing ratios shifts the focus of the neural attention map.
pro_tips: Use 21:9 for cinematic panoramas and 9:16 for mobile-optimized vertical feeds. Subject-to-frame ratio is key.

title: FACE DETAILER
definition: A secondary high-resolution pass that utilizes face-detection algorithms to re-synthesize facial features at micro-scale.
why_it_matters: Eliminates facial degradation in wide shots. Restores anatomical accuracy and photographic clarity to human subjects.
pro_tips: Essential for professional output. Set denoise to 0.45 for the perfect balance of detail and natural skin texture.

title: RESOLUTION SYNTHESIS
definition: Large-scale neural enlargement that injects sub-pixel detail and high-frequency textures into the final asset.
why_it_matters: Base generations are low resolution. Upscaling is required for high-fidelity printing and 4K digital displays.
pro_tips: Explore concepts at base resolution (fast) and only commit to Upscaling for finalized assets to save system uptime.

title: LIGHTING GRADE
definition: Final stage luminosity and color grading adjustments. Simulates real-world optical effects and camera sensor properties.
why_it_matters: Provides the 'finished' photographic feel. Hides digital smoothness and anchors the image in a physical reality.
pro_tips: Use subtle Film Grain to blend neural artifacts. A slight Vignette focuses visual attention on the primary subject.

title: SAMPLING ENGINE
definition: The mathematical algorithm responsible for navigating the latent space to resolve an image from pure noise.
why_it_matters: Different engines have different 'trajectories', resulting in different textures, sharpness, and stylistic biases.
pro_tips: Euler is the fastest reliable path. DPM++ 2M is optimized for maximum textural detail in realistic renders.

title: ITERATION STEPS
definition: The number of sequential passes the AI makes to clarify and refine the visual representation.
why_it_matters: Determines total refinement depth. Too few steps result in muddy noise; too many result in diminishing returns.
pro_tips: UMRGEN-v0.8 is hyper-optimized for 4-12 steps. Increasing steps beyond absolute necessity wastes compute cycles.

title: SCALE MAGNITUDE
definition: The multiplication factor applied to the base resolution during the neural upscaling pass.
why_it_matters: Determines final pixel density. X2 is optimal for web/social; X4 is intensive but necessary for large-format print.
pro_tips: Synthesis time scales exponentially with magnitude. Balance your requirement for detail against processing time.

title: INTERFACE LOGIC
definition: Global application behavior and accessibility settings, including the interactive Learning Mode toggle.
why_it_matters: Enables customization of the operator experience. Learning Mode provides real-time tactical data on all parameters.
pro_tips: Keep Learning Mode active during system onboarding. Disable once parameter behavior is fully internalized.
